I don't feel secure here at all . Most of the people are in their own bubble and if you are too honest and say things that could potentially hurt their ego, you are in trouble. Razorpay may be doing well overall but there are aspects where they are quite backward imo. Employee care is definitely not a priority. headline: I'm highly satisfied joining Razorpay
pros:
Before I go on to pros, let me give a brief overview. I used to work in a highly reputed MNC, and I was skeptical on joining a startup. But that's one of the best decisions I've made in my career. And the decision couldn't have been better choosing Razorpay.
1. They care for their employees. They host regular stress management/employee engagement/therapy sessions. So if you're stressed at work, they'll make sure to reduce it through fun online events (since office is closed due to covid).

2. They give you exactly that kinda work, that you love to do. I'm an ambitious millennial who's driven by work. I left my last job, simply because there wasn't enough work and the work that I used to do didn't excite me. It's not the case here. I absolutely love the work that I do. There are challenging complex problems I get to solve daily. It satisfies my zeal. So if you're a passionate coder like me, there are enough problems for you to keep your hunger satisfied. 

3. So now, about your learning curve. My manager not only wants to get the work done for the team, but wants me to keep on growing my knowledge. The company pushes everyone to do new courses, get certifications and so on. People who work here are one of the smartest people in the industry, so you learn a lot from your peers. And also, the work you do is on a broad spectrum, hence there's huge knowledge gain there.

4. The culture is amazing. People are super helpful... I've joined during covid times, hence not sure about office, but the management does what's needed to keep you entertained. We have gaming competitions, antaksharis, and so on... before every townhall, we have small concerts... In short, you're never bored.
cons: There's Yin and Yan in everything, but in my tenure, I've not faced any cons... If I do face anything down the line, I'll make sure to comeback and update.

- In last 6 months 8 full timers & 1 contractor left and joined 5 contractors. This is degrading the quality of the company by big margin.

headline: Promising workplace, Good products
pros:
1) One of the most employee centric company in terms of right to be heard and good perks.
2) Don't like anything in company? You're free to discuss to your manager / HR.
3) Lunch and Evening snacks. And also Dinner if you stay late. Lunch is not good sometimes. Evening snacks are mostly not healthy. 
4) Pool table, xbox. Good for those who play.
5) ESOPs buyback happened 2 times which is appreciable and shows that they're transparent in what they've offered to their employees.
6) Colourful office.
7) Most people here are good skill wise.
8) Now, we've massage chairs.
cons:
Transition from startup to mature startup is still in phase. Things are getting better.

1) TT table coming soon, I guess.
2) Meetings are kept on any of the 5+ floor. But lift is very slow.
3) Flexi employee benefits not available. Medical insurance is waste for me as most people always have their personal medical insurance which is of much higher value than provider.
4) We've esops portal but no option to exercise vested esops. Can only see details.
5) Growth is slow unlike in small startup. Opportunities of growth are slowed down because quality projects which can demonstrate your skills are not available all the time. So, you grow here with how fast is the tide in your team.
6) Tired of parking space issues. Have to pay and park in forum sometimes.
7) People don't use Slack responsibly. They keep tagging all day without knowing relevant POC.
8) Give employee performance feedback regularly.
9) Some people need to take ownership and take decisions by self rather than pushing them to work.
10) Review cycle is extended by 1 month.
11) You don't get bonus for entire duration if you leave in the last month.

Such parts are messed up as team size scaled exponentially in 1.5yrs. Good thing is Razorpay is open to improve things.

headline: Great Work Culture
pros:
1. Great Work Culture - You would just love working here. The culture is very transparent and progressive.
2. Supportive Management - Management Team is always accessible and follow an open door policy
3. Constructive Mindset - This is very key and right from the management to every single person here want to change and make this better.
4. Growth Oriented - The company is very focussed towards growth and have an excellent team to support it.
5. Employee Focus - A great focus is given to employees growth and work life balance. Ofcourse not every time things work in our favour but a proper work life balance is a top priority for the management.
6. Stable: The company is very stable, and even though well funded, is very conscious about putting the money at the right place.
7. Innovative: The company focusses a lot on Innovation and the way it has moved from being a Payment Gateway company to Payment Solutions company, talks about the progressive and innovative culture.
8. Right mix of people: While most of the team members are young and energetic, the company has put in very senior and experienced people to lead key functions and assist in growing the company. Its great to learn from them.
cons: The company is still growing. Hence there are some process gaps which the company is working towards plugging.
